title: We’re Playing Basketball
text: This is a post for my basketball post!

title: About
text:
Hello everyone! My name is Sameer Sapre and I am an analyst working in the Baseball Projects group with the Seattle Mariners.
I am also currently a graduate student at the University of Washington studying Industrial Engineering.
In my free time, I enjoy playing new sports, hiking, and cooking with friends.
Outside of work and school I am a volunteer usher with Seattle Thetre Group and am the VP of Public Relationships for my local Toastmaster’s chapter.

title: Predicting NFL Game Outcomes with nflfastR
text:
Hello everyone! Today I want to share a quick tutorial on using nflreadR to build a simple game outcome model.
First, a quick introduction of nflreadR - it’s part of the nflverse family of packages in R that all easily and efficiently obtaining data from NFL games. In this post, we’ll be using its suite of functions to get the data we need to build a predictive model.

# install and load packages
#install.packages("nflreadr")
library(nflreadr)
